Akshayvarun Subramanya

I am a PhD student at the Dept. of CSEE of University of Maryland. Baltimore County (UMBC), where I work on Machine learning and Computer vision. My PhD advisor is Hamed Pirsiavash.

Prior to joining UMBC, I was a Research Assistant at Indian Institute of Science under Prof.Venkatesh Babu, as part of Video Analytics Lab. Additionally, I worked on software APIs, active illumination systems, human-computer interaction devices, and helped develop demos for trade shows, including CES 2012-2016.

I have an MS in Computer Science (AI focus) from Stanford University, where I was a research assistant for Silvio Savarese and a teaching assistant for Fei-Fei Li (CS131 & CS231N). I have a BS in EECS from UC Berkeley, where I worked in Kris Pister's lab.

Email  /  Google Scholar  /  LinkedIn

Research

I'm interested in computer vision, machine learning, optimization, graphics and robotics.
